index.js

 
"use strict"
var os = require("os")

var hasUnicode = module.exports = function () {

Recent Win32 platforms (>XP) CAN support unicode in the console but don't have to, and in non-english locales often use traditional local code pages. There's no way, short of windows system calls or execing the chcp command line program to figure this out. As such, we default this to false and encourage your users to override it via config if appropriate.

 
  if (os.type() == "Windows_NT") { return false }

  var isUTF8 = /[.]UTF-8/
  if (isUTF8.test(process.env.LC_ALL)
   || process.env.LC_CTYPE == 'UTF-8'
   || isUTF8.test(process.env.LANG)) {
    return true
  }

  return false
}
